intro: Melampyrum silesiacum, commonly known as the Silesian touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges. Its name "touch-me-not" refers to the sticky glands on its stems that deter herbivores.
